item.title: Cylinder eye completely disassembled
item.description: The eye of a hydraulic cylinder is fully torn down for inspection and repair, revealing critical wear points and restoration methods. What can teardown reveal that visual checks cannot?

media:content.media:title: Cylinder eye completely disassembled
media:content.media:description: The eye of a hydraulic cylinder is fully torn down for inspection and repair, revealing critical wear points and restoration methods. What can teardown reveal that visual checks cannot?

item.title: Drilling and tapping a 2-metre bar
item.description: With a vintage milling and drilling attachment mounted, multiple holes are drilled, reamed, and tapped to fit 12mm tooling. How does precision setup affect final results?

item.title: Upgrading workshop storage
item.description: See how a workshop storage upgrade improves organization, efficiency, and workflow for machining and engineering projects. How can storage changes boost productivity?

item.title: New year, better workshop setup
item.description: A look at workshop improvements to start the year more organized and efficient, including tools, layout, and workspaces. What small changes make the biggest impact?

item.title: Repairing hydraulic cylinder barrels
item.description: Follow along as hydraulic cylinder barrels are inspected, repaired, and restored for reliable performance in demanding applications. What steps are most critical for a lasting repair?

item.title: 150-tonne hydraulic jacking cylinder rebuild
item.description: A full rebuild of a massive 150-tonne hydraulic jacking cylinder, showing disassembly, inspection, and restoration steps. Whatâ€™s involved in restoring such large machinery?

item.title: Heavy-duty tool post grinder in action
item.description: See a heavy-duty tool post grinder at work, tackling multiple tasks and demonstrating efficiency and versatility in machining. What challenges does this machine handle best?

item.title: Internal damage in a hydraulic cylinder
item.description: A closer look at a cylinder that was being damaged from the inside, with inspection and repair techniques explained. What signs indicate internal wear early?

item.title: Exploring our SIP jig borer tooling
item.description: A detailed look at a SIP jig borer tooling collection, highlighting various tools, their functions, and applications in machining. How do these tools improve precision work?

item.title: Oxy gas cutting a D11 ripper shank
item.description: Watch a broken D11 ripper shank being carefully cut using oxy gas and a beetle torch, highlighting safe techniques in heavy equipment repair. How does precision cutting help in tough repairs?

item.title: Creating a shop-made boring bar over a meter long
item.description: Watch the making of a custom boring bar exceeding one meter, designed for precise machining in the workshop. How do custom tools improve accuracy?

item.title: Repairing a CAT 637 scraper bail arm
item.description: This video shows the inspection and repair of a CAT 637 scraper bail arm, focusing on techniques to restore strength and reliability. What steps ensure a durable repair?

item.title: Making Heavy-Duty Steel Rollers
item.description: Solid steel billets are machined into heavy-duty rollers used in industrial applications. What machining steps ensure strength and balance?

item.title: Repairing a Broken Bail Arm
item.description: Part one of a step-by-step bail arm repair, covering damage assessment and initial machining. What determines whether repair or replacement is best?

item.title: Crafting a custom Caterpillar engine pin
item.description: Watch the precise creation of a custom pin for a Caterpillar 3500 series engine cylinder head, showcasing advanced machining techniques. What makes custom engine parts critical?

item.title: Removing a Worn Track Adjuster Sleeve
item.description: Air arc gouging is used to remove a worn sleeve from a track adjuster assembly. How does controlled material removal speed up major repairs?

item.title: Replacing a Damaged Grader Circle
item.description: An overview of removing and replacing a worn grader circle, highlighting wear points and precision fitting. Why is this component vital to grader performance?

item.title: Boring Out a Bucket Cylinder Rod Eye
item.description: Precision boring work on a bucket cylinder rod eye, focusing on alignment and surface finish. Why is accuracy critical in high-load joints?

item.title: Machining an Adapter Plate for a Dyno
item.description: The creation of a custom adapter plate for a transmission dynamometer. Why are one-off components common in testing environments?

item.title: Repairing a 16H Hydraulic Cylinder
item.description: A hydraulic cylinder repair focusing on inspection, machining, and reassembly. What causes failure in high-load cylinder systems?
